packets.name: Display Sign Gump
packets.description: Displays a sign gump with text to the client.

packets.name: Close Gump
packets.description: Instructs client to close a specific gump.

fields.name: Button ID
fields.description: Button ID (0 to close without response)

packets.name: Dynamic Gump (Compressed)
packets.description: Sends a custom gump dialog with compressed layout and text strings. Uses raw DEFLATE compression (no zlib headers).

fields.name: Type ID
fields.description: Gump type ID (identifies the gump class)

fields.name: Layout Data
fields.description: DEFLATE compressed layout commands (ASCII, no zlib header/footer). Length = Layout Compressed Length - 4

fields.name: Strings Data
fields.description: DEFLATE compressed strings (no zlib header/footer). Length = Strings Compressed Length - 4

compression.notes: Uses libdeflate. NO zlib header (0x78 0x9C) or footer (adler32 checksum). Layout and strings are compressed separately.

layoutFormat.description: Layout is a custom ASCII text format. Each command is brace-wrapped: { command param1 param2 ... }
layoutFormat.encoding: ASCII (arguments must be ASCII characters only)

commands.name: Noclose
commands.description: Prevent closing via right-click or ESC

commands.name: Page
commands.description: Define page (0=base visible on all pages)

args.name: Gump ID
args.description: Gump graphic ID for the background

commands.name: Picinpic
commands.description: Cropped sprite from gump (sprite image rendering)

args.name: Button ID
args.description: Button ID sent to server on click

args.name: Button ID
args.description: Button ID sent to server on click

stringsFormat.description: Array of UTF-16 BE encoded strings for text/textentry elements

entryFormat.name: Text
entryFormat.description: UTF-16 BE encoded text. Length = Length field * 2 bytes

related.note: Gump Response - client reply to button/checkbox/text

clientVersion.notes: Compressed gumps supported since Classic Client 3.0.0

packets.notes: Layout uses ASCII encoding only. The compressed lengths include a +4 offset. Decompression produces: layout as ASCII text, strings as length-prefixed UTF-16 BE entries.
